intro: Laurentia minuta var. minima, commonly known as the small laurentia, is a diminutive flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its compact size and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for gardeners seeking a low-maintenance, shade-tolerant plant. It is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and maintaining biodiversity in its native habitat.
